channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: California governor signs bills to bolster gun control
item.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom has signed several new gun control laws aimed at expanding restrictions on firearm ownership. These include provisions against individuals involved in stalking, animal cruelty, and domestic violence. The legislation also targets ghost guns and aims to enhance protections for domestic violence survivors. Newsom stressed California's proactive approach amid a lack of federal action.

item.title: 'We really need to do it': JPMorgan CEO backs Elon Musk’s ‘very good idea’
item.description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon endorses Elon Musk's proposal for a government efficiency commission, emphasizing the need for accountability and efficient public spending at the India Investor Summit. Former President Donald Trump also supports the idea, pledging to appoint Musk if re-elected. The commission aims to audit federal operations and recommend reforms to eliminate fraud.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'You will not boost your power at Ukraine's expense': Zelenskyy takes aim at China, Brazil
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the UN General Assembly, questioning China and Brazil's true interest in proposing peace talks with Russia. He criticized temporary truce plans and asserted that Ukraine would reject any externally imposed agreements. Zelenskyy cautioned that alternative peace efforts would only prolong the conflict instead of achieving genuine resolution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US revokes Georgian PM's Invitation to Biden's UN reception amid strained ties
item.description: Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze's invitation to a reception hosted by US President Joe Biden during the UNGA was revoked due to alleged anti-democratic actions and negative rhetoric towards the US. This development underscores strained relations between Georgia and Western powers, amid accusations of authoritarianism and pro-Russian policies from the ruling Georgian Dream party.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Man hijacks bus in Los Angeles, 1 passenger killed
item.description: Early Wednesday in downtown Los Angeles, a man hijacked a Metro bus, holding the driver at gunpoint and fatally shooting a passenger. Police pursued the bus for an hour before arresting the suspect and finally later the driver and another passenger were rescued without injuries. Police said that the investigation remains ongoing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israeli NGO Shavei Israel appeals for immigration of deceased Indian-origin soldier Geri Gideon Hanghal's family
item.description: Shavei Israel, an Israeli NGO, is calling for support to help the family of Indian-origin Staff Sergeant Geri Gideon Hanghal immigrate to Israel after he was killed in a vehicle-ramming attack. The organization emphasizes aiding Bnei Menashe community members still in India who wish to make aliyah.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sri Lanka's parliamentary election will cost approx Rs 3 billion, more expensive than presidential poll
item.description: Anura Kumara Dissanayake's recent victory has led to an early parliamentary election in Sri Lanka, costing 11 billion Sri Lankan rupees which is up from 10 billion rupees from presidential polls. Dissolving Parliament 11 months ahead of schedule, Dissanayake diverges from former president Ranil Wickremesinghe's plans to delay elections due to economic constraints and prioritize financial recovery.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Philippines military backs permanent stay of US missile system
item.description: Philippine military chief General Romeo Brawner supports the permanent presence of a US missile system in his country, despite China's objections. The Typhon mid-range missile system was deployed during joint exercises and has not been removed. Defence Secretary Gilberto Teodoro criticized China for interfering and urged Beijing to dismantle its own military assets.

item.title: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau faces no-confidence vote in Liberal-minority government
item.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's main rival in Canada's parliament on Tuesday introduced a motion of no confidence in the ruling Liberals, in a first major test of his unpopular minority government. In Canada's Westminster parliamentary system, a ruling party must hold the confidence of the House of Commons, which means maintaining support from a majority of members.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris to push new incentives to boost domestic manufacturing in Pittsburgh
item.description: Kamala Harris will propose new incentives to boost domestic manufacturing in Pennsylvania. Her policies aim to build on her platform of homebuyer subsidies, small business tax breaks, and a federal ban on grocery price gouging. Both candidates are focusing on the economy, which is a primary concern for voters.

item.title: Is Musk dating Meloni? Tesla CEO says 'we are ... '
item.description: Elon Musk dispelled rumors of dating Italian Prime Minister Georgia Meloni after their photo went viral on social media. He clarified the situation on X, stating they are not dating. Musk also praised Meloni during an awards ceremony in New York, commending her authenticity and honesty as a politician.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I did all this deviant, sexual stuff': Indian origin former NYC health adviser fired over sex party revelations
item.description: Dr Jay Varma, the former Covid-19 czar of New York City, has been dismissed from SIGA Technologies following revelations of his participation in drug-fuelled sex parties during the pandemic. Secret recordings disclosed his attendance at underground raves and hosting events while NYC was under lockdowns. He admitted to attending two private gatherings between April 2020 and May 2021.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Can see strings': Vivek Ramaswamy takes 'puppet' jibe as Alex Soros hosts Tim Walz at his place
item.description: Vivek Ramaswamy labeled Alex Soros a 'puppet' after he hosted Democrat Tim Walz. Elon Musk also criticized Soros for backing Kamala Harris. Both Alex and his father, George Soros, are strong supporters of Harris and the Democratic Party, contributing substantial amounts to their campaigns in recent elections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tsunami alert in Australia turns out to be 'test warning' by authorities
item.description: Australians faced panic on Wednesday after receiving tsunami warnings via their weather app, which were later clarified as tests by the Bureau of Meteorology. The alert stemmed from an 8.2 magnitude earthquake off New Zealand's west coast. Authorities subsequently issued a "cancelled tsunami warning" and apologized for any confusion caused.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Hope America wipes Iran off face of Earth': Trump after US intel warns of Iran assassination threats
item.description: US intelligence warned Donald Trump of specific threats from Iran to assassinate him, prompting Trump to vow strong action against the nation. His campaign claims that Iran aims to destabilize the US elections through coordinated attacks and cyberattacks, which Iran denies. Both Trump's and Kamala Harris's campaigns reported foreign hacking attempts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Big threats on my life by Iran': Trump says surrounded by more guns than ever seen before
item.description: Donald Trump revealed that US intelligence has warned him of a serious assassination threat from Iran. He expressed gratitude to Congress for unanimously approving an increased budget for the Secret Service. Trump urged America to take decisive action against Iran if any such attempts occur, calling it a dire situation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Laurene Powell Jobs? Invisible hand behind Kamala Harris's rise
item.description: Laurene Powell Jobs, worth $11 billion, is significantly influencing the 2024 US presidential elections. She has been a crucial supporter of Kamala Harris, donating millions and aiding Biden's exit from the race. Powell owns The Atlantic and holds shares in Monumental Sports & Entertainment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Marcellus Williams? Missouri man executed despite victim's family’s calls to spare his life
item.description: Marcellus Williams, who consistently claimed innocence, was executed by lethal injection in Missouri despite objections from the local prosecutor and calls for clemency. Previous stays of execution did not overturn his conviction. A new DNA analysis led to the state Supreme Court rejecting arguments for his innocence, resulting in his execution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris let 21 million people enter US, many terrorists: Donald Trump
item.description: Donald Trump accused Kamala Harris of allowing over 21 million people, mostly 'terrorists,' to enter the U.S., causing tremendous damage. He claimed only he could fix this problem. Earlier, a Fox News report estimated around 7.3 million migrants had illegally crossed the southwest border during President Biden's tenure.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump: Zelenskyy ‘greatest salesman on Earth’
item.description: Donald Trump criticized US aid to Ukraine and praised Russia's military history, promising to end the conflict if elected. He mocked President Biden's stance and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy. Meanwhile, at the UN, Zelenskyy called for global powers to force Russia into a peace settlement, rejecting any negotiations on Moscow’s terms.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
